intro: Begonia laminariae, commonly known as the silver-leaf begonia, is a species native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety silver-gray foliage that contrasts beautifully with its deep green veins. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and pink, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental appeal, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
